title: Dinosaur National Monument: Learn About the Park
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park           Learn About the Park        Biological Technician, Peter Williams, talks with visitors along the Yampa River. NPS/Jacob W. Frank   Â    Looking for more information? Explore the other pages in this section to learn more. News Browse press release, subscribe to updates, or dig into archived news. Photos & More Experience Dinosaur from afar. Check out our webcam, photo galleries, videos and more. Nature Located on the northern edge of the Colorado Plateau, Dinosaur is the intersection for several distinct geographic and biological regions. This supports a diversity of plant and animal species. Learn more about the monument's paleontology, geology, wildlife and environment. Education Dinosaur provides a variety of experiences for educators to utilize this outdoor classroom. Learn how to plan a field trip. Kids & Youth Learn how you can become a Junior Ranger! Management Browse planning documents that guide how Dinosaur is run day-to-day. Bookstore Intermountain Natural History Association is the non-profit partner of Dinosaur National Monument, Fossil Butte National Monument, Ashley National Forest, Flaming Gorge National Recreation Area and several small sites maintained by the Bureau of Land Management. A percentage of all purchases made at one of their bookstores or online helps fund projects and operations at Dinosaur National Monument as well as other sites.
